CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| methyl groups |
| PCDSeBT |

Explanation:

1. "methyl groups" is mentioned as a material used in the model dimeric system.
2. "PCDSeBT" is a material whose optimized molecular geometry and frontier molecular orbitals were computed.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |

Explanation:

1. "methyl groups" is not a clear material name in this context, as it is used to build the model dimeric system, but it is not a material being investigated or analyzed in the study.
2. "PCDSeBT" is the only clear material name in this paragraph, as it is the subject of the investigation and its optimized molecular geometry and frontier molecular orbitals are being computed.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| molecular geometry of PCDSeBT |
| frontier molecular orbitals |
| the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces |

Explanation:

1. "molecular geometry of PCDSeBT" is a property name as it refers to the arrangement of atoms in the PCDSeBT molecule.
2. "frontier molecular orbitals" is a property name as it refers to the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of the system.
3. "the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces" is a property name as it refers to the representation of the HOMO and LUMO orbitals as surfaces of constant energy in the molecule.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| molecular geometry of PCDSeBT |
| frontier molecular orbitals |
| the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces |

Explanation:

1. "molecular geometry of PCDSeBT" is a material property as it refers to the arrangement of atoms in the PCDSeBT molecule.
2. "frontier molecular orbitals" is a material property as it refers to the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of the system.
3. "the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces" is a material property as it refers to the representation of the HOMO and LUMO orbitals as surfaces of constant energy in the molecule.
